definition: lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
I/me/my
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: You become embroiled in competitive dating battles.
sentences.chinese: 陷入一场你争我夺的约会战。

sentences.english: Each scrambled for the football at the football ground.

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
friendly one-upmanship/to try to emulate
to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
wrestling/a trial of strength
to fight over/to scramble for
struggle/war
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
to fight desperately
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
neither giving way to the other
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
to fight at close quarters/hand-to-hand
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
